results.title: Nova: the search for life
results.brief_description: Explains DNA and how it works. Shows an experiment by Professor Stanley Miller in which he produced amino acids, and an experiment by researchers at the University of Miami who created small moving one-celled creatures by putting drops of amino acids on hot lava and washing them off with rainwater. Narrated by Hal Douglas.

results.title: Physical examination
results.brief_description: A physical examination need not be a mysterious and fearful experience of young children. This film prepares the child by explaining the process, step-by-step, in a gently humorous way. Parents and medical personnel also learn how to describe examination procedures to children so that their fears and anxieties are minimized.

results.title: What happens when you're sick?
results.creator_credit: Michael Heldman and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Shows why we experience symptoms such as fever, sneezing, upset stomach and diarrhoea when we’re sick and symptoms such as bleeding, swelling, and pain when we’re injured.

results.title: Yesterday's witness: a tribute to the American newsreel
results.brief_description:
A chronicle of the newsreel in America, the curious child of journalism and show business that pioneered the coverage of news on film. Format of the film is similar to a newsreel with respect to the juxtaposition of images, the raising of issues without following them through, and the shock value of pictures.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: SOS
results.brief_description: Comical but scathing indictment of man’s age-old exploitation of women, presented via the historical theories of a mad professor who is convinced that women are temporary visitors from a far-away galaxy. Starring Maurizio Nichetti as the teacher. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Tale of a TV mouse
results.brief_description: The story of a puppet mouse named Lucille, whose entire life revolves around the television. Shows how it affects her life and what finally happens to convince her to break the TV habit. Presents the problems of habitual TV viewing and provides positive alternatives for children who watch a lot of TV.

results.title: Beyond cubism
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at some of the sculpture of this century, including the works, philosophies and sources of inspiration of such artists as Marcel Duchamp, Man Ray, Joan Miro, Alexander Calder, Alberto Glacommetti, Barbara Hepworth and Anthony Caro.

results.title: Woolloomooloo
results.brief_description: A social and historical documentary on the redevelopment of one of Sydney’s oldest harbourside areas, from the initial plans of 1969 to the completion of the Housing Commission’s renovation project in late 1977. Details the roles of local, State and Federal governments, the State Planning Authority, The National Trust, the developers, the Builders’ Labourers Federation led by Jack Mundey, and the residents groups.
